subject: Officiating (Sports)
Frauds and Swindling
lead_paragraph: A high school classmate of the disgraced former N.B.A. referee Tim Donaghy who is charged with paying for inside betting information has opted to seek a trial rather than accept a plea deal. James Battista, 42, who is charged with conspiracy to engage in wire fraud and transmitting betting information over state lines, appeared in Brooklyn federal court before United States District Court Judge Carol B. Amon on Monday as lawyers set dates for a change of venue hearing and a possible trial.
